means: 牧羊人，羊倌( shepherd的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Every summer the shepherds drive the sheep up to pasture.
sentence.Network_cn: 每年夏天牧羊人都将羊群赶到牧场去。
牧羊人把他们的羊群关入栏中.

sentence.Network_en: This was the first time the shepherds had seen the Corleone stare.
sentence.Network_cn: 这两个牧民第一次看到考利昂家族传统的瞪眼.

PerfectNetExp.abs: then the shepherds came and drove them away , but Moses and helped them and watered their flock .有牧羊的人来，把她们赶走了，摩西却起来帮助她们，又饮了她们的群羊。
and see the shepherds feed their flocks ., 看牧童放牧一群群牛羊.
They dressed themselves up as shepherds for fancy dress ball ., 他们把自己打扮成牧羊人来参加化装舞会.
shepherds know every sheep bells make , and Gabriel immediately realized that his sheep were running fast .牧羊人都知道每一种铃声意味着什么，盖伯瑞认识到此刻他的羊群正在疯狂地奔跑。

[德国狼犬（German Shepherd），是德国最具代表性的工作犬。因为聪明丶易于训练，警觉性又高，在战争中成为德国最受倚重的军 …

entry.def: A shepherd is a person, especially a man, whose job is to look after sheep.
If you are shepherded somewhere, someone takes you there to make sure that you arrive at the right place safely.

example.ex: She was shepherded by her guards up the rear ramp of the aircraft.
example.tran: 她在警卫的护送下上了飞机尾部的舷梯。
